title.narrative: Improving community agricultural production, sanitation and health in La Paz Dept, Bolivia

description.narrative: This new project combines together Fundación Nuna’s agricultural production project (previously BOL156) with the project working with children on agroecology and young people on produce transformation BOL151). Fundacion Nuna’s team will provide support to rural indigenous communities to achieve improvements in sustainable agricultural production and community organisation in the department of La Paz. The team will provide small-scale farming households with training and technical accompaniment in sustainable and innovative agricultural practices aiming to increase their production and also reduce their vulnerability to the impacts of climate change. Nuna will also provide support to improve resilience, providing training on the transformation and sale of agricultural produce and on the extraction / gathering of seeds from current crops for future harvest cycles. The team promote civic participation, transparency and accountability, in particular through the participation and skills of women, young people and children. The results of the baseline study in the previous project cycle alongside the onset of the pandemic increased concerns about sanitation practices and lack of family infrastructure. In this new cycle, Nuna’s team will broaden in scope to include training and materials to support improved awareness and implementation of safe sanitary practices, thereby improving child health in terms of both sanitation and nutrition. Nuna’s commitment to recuperating indigenous knowledge, validating indigenous culture and practices and addressing gender inequality underpin their methodology and institutional approaches.
